alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 19 at 4:45PM MST until February 21 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT SUNDAY FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY VALUES, AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT MONDAY FOR EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY VALUES AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... .Increasing westerlies, strong mixing and a deepening lee side trough, combined with very dry conditions, above normal temperatures, and an unstable atmosphere, will bring several hours of critical fire weather conditions to the East Central Plains on Sunday. Winds will increase further on Monday, allowing for critical fire weather conditions to develop across all of eastern New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MST SUNDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the East Central Plains late Sunday morning through early Sunday evening and again late Monday morning through early Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Westerly 15 to 30 mph with occasional gusts to 35 or 40 mph on Sunday. Southwesterly 25 to 35 mph with gusts near 45 mph on Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum between 8 and 13 percent each day. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning for Sunday. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch for Monday.
